0.user_question: A book store had 4 books in the bargin bin. If they sold 3 books, but then put 10 more in the bin, how many books would be in the bin?

ost_step.1: Identify the initial number of books. The problem states there were 4 books in the bargain bin.
ost_step.2: Subtract the number of books sold from the initial number to find out how many books remained. The problem states they sold 3 books. So, there were 4 (initial number of books) - 3 (books sold) = 1 book remaining.
ost_step.3: Add the number of new books to the remaining number of books. The problem states they added 10 more books to the bin. So, there are now 1 (remaining books) + 10 (new books) = 11 books in the bin.
